english: to eat; to consume; to suffer/endure; be stumped by

etymology.description: semantic: 口 (kǒu) + phonetic: 乞 (qǐ; OC *kʰɯds, *kʰɯd).
etymology.interpretation: Combines the mouth component 口 with the sound-bearing 乞, tying the graph to actions involving the mouth. Its early sense was “to stutter,” with 乞 contributing the sound and, via later borrowing as “beg,” a nuance linked to halting speech; the folk idea of “less air” is incorrect since 乞 was originally a variant of 气 meaning “air.”

examples.chinese: 他吃不消这么大的工作量(他吃不消這麼大的工作量)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chī bùxiāo zhème dà de gōngzuòliàng.
examples.english: He can’t endure such a heavy workload.

examples.chinese: 我被这道难题吃住了(我被這道難題吃住了)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bèi zhè dào nántí chī zhù le.
examples.english: I was stumped by this difficult problem.
